sentences.text: In this paper we specialize the projective unifocal , bifo-cal , and trifocal tensors to the affine case , and show how the tensors obtained relate to the registered tensors encountered in previous work .
This enables us to obtain an affine specialization of known projective relations connecting points and lines across two or three views .
In the simpler case of affine cameras we give neccessary and sufficient constraints on the components of the trifocal tensor , together with a simple geometric interpretation .
Finally , we show how the estimation of the tensors from point correspondences is achieved through factorization , and discuss the estimation from line correspondences .

kg2text: In computer vision, trifocal tensors provide a mathematical representation of projective relations connecting points and lines across three views. This specialization of known projective relations gives rise to an affine case where transformations are reduced to linear ones. The trifocal tensor has a simple geometric interpretation in the context of affine cameras. Furthermore, trifocal tensors can be specialized to relate registered tensors from previous work, providing a broader understanding of their structure and relationships. In addition, bifo-cal and projective unifocal tensors also specialize to this affine case, offering insights into the connections between multiple views.
